templateAssets.content: ADDITIONAL APPROVED COURSES FOR THE MAJOR
MAJOR PREPARATION COURSES REQUIRED FOR TRANSFER

The Business Administration major at The Paul Merage School of Business offers a traditional business curriculum similar to those at other top business schools in the country. The major is broad, drawing on the social sciences more generally to study organizations, interpersonal communication skills, individual and group behavior, leadership, strategy, financial and accounting issues, ethics, information technology, marketing, and a variety of other topics in the context of a rapidly changing global environment.

                                       

Preference for admission will be given to Junior-level applicants with the highest grades overall (minimum cumulative UC transferable GPA of 3.0) who satisfactorily complete lower-division required courses. This major does not participate in the TAG Program.


Required for admission:


  • Calculus (MATH 2A-2B),                                                     
  • Economics (ECON 20A-20B or MGMT 4A-4B),                                                  
  • Statistics (MGMT 7), and                                                     
  • Accounting (MGMT 30A-30B)


﻿MGMT 1 may be completed at UCI.


Students select a minimum of one of six emphases from the following:   

      

  • Accounting                                                                   
  • Finance                                                                    
  • Information Systems                                                          
  • Marketing                                                                    
  • Operations and Decision Technologies                                         
  • Organization and Management


Admission to the major will be competitive due to limited space availability.


NOTE: In fulfillment of the requirements below, a single course may be used only once.                                  


For information regarding the AP and IB examination credit policies refer to the UCI General Catalogue.
